intro: Pseudognaphalium perpusillum, commonly known as the dwarf fleabane, is a small flowering plant native to the United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. It has tiny, bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, and its leaves are usually covered in fine hairs. Pseudognaphalium perpusillum is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to thrive in dry, well-drained conditions.
